Pros: Amazing Bass Amazing Mid Amazing Highs I couldn't believe how different music sounded when I put these headphones on for the first time. They are very comfortable. I can listen to them for hours without pain. The padding is not hard leather feeling, it's like pillows. You can hear things that you never heard in music before... I don't think I will ever go back to cheap regular headphones (I don't know if that is a pro or a con :D)...
Cons: Hmm if I had to come up with one... It costs a lot. But if you think about it, you get what you pay for with headphones, but these were well worth the coin for me. I loved them so much that I bought myself a set of them (The first pair I bought as a gift for my girlfriend).
Newegg was awesome with this transaction. The ... day after I purchased the first set of headphones, they went on sale $20 cheaper with a promo code. I contacted NewEgg via instant chat and they credited my PayPal account after the transaction was final. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Great closed headphones for the price
Item.Review:
Pros: For the quality, theses are the least expensive decent quality closed headphones you can buy. They also stay on your head pretty well and are comfortable. They are slightly muddy sounding in the bass, but only slightly. The bass response is good down to around 30Hz.
Cons: Look silly if you use them in public, but who cares. You can get better open headphones for the price but you need a quite place to use them and will annoy others around you. For closed headphones, these are a good value.
Someone mentioned "burn-in" here. That's completely false. Ask them to cite any proof, the only 'proof' is anecdotal and is most likely the result of a placebo effect. However, there is actually a study where someone tested a pair of high-end headphone before and after a burn- ... in. He injected flat-band noise and measured the response of the headphones. After 6 days of continuous burn-in, there was no change in the measured response. Even the manufacturers officially state the headphones are not designed to have a "burn-in". Email them, call them, ask them. They may have been confused as SOME higher end subs do need to be burned in, but the manufacturers released detailed burn-in instructions. As a scientist and engineer, I am offended by people who make such ignorant claims. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Great for field work, but not post
Item.Review: With their great sound-blocking, these are excellent for recording sound in the field. They are not, however, detailed enough for dedicated post work. They'll work in a pinch and perform well for the price, but just don't have the frequency response for editing and sound design. But, that's not what they're for. They do an excellent job at their assigned task: monitoring recording.
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sound, if properly used.
Cons: Finding an external sound card to accept the 1/4" plug. After 5 years of use I had the plastic band warrantied as it started to crack and chip due to the size of my head and it cracked again.
These need extra power for the bass. Just plugging these into a sound card isn't enough and will give you poor bass results like so many are reporting. Devices/sound cards that accept the 1/4" plug will give you the proper results you are looking for as the 1/8" usually just don't have enough "oompf."

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything.
Cons: Nothing.
I've had a pair of these head phones for over 3 yrs. now and they still sound amazing. The highs and lows are very crisp and clear.
The only thing that's happened with mine is the plastic coating around the earpieces are tearing. But to me, that's not that big of a deal. It doesn't affect the sound quality or the level of comfort. It's more of an aesthetic thing than anything else.
Overall, this is a GREAT set of headphones.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: I use my headphones mostly at night when listening to music so I don't bother my roommate. The sound from them is very good for the price. I don't have any experience using very expensive headphones (over $250) so I can't compare these to the top-of-the-line pairs. I can tell you that these are very noticeably better than a cheap pair. Good value buy.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Great price, amazing quality for sound and construction.
Cons: no case.
First of all, one person on here has no clue what they're talking about. I got these to mix live sound and to use in the studio. I also use the when listening to my ipod at night. They're some of the most comfortable headphones I've ever worn. There;s a reason why they're one of the most used pair of headphones in Pro Audio. Overall, they are an excellent pair of phones. The only thing I would like is a case or pouch to carry them in. oh well, they're great!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: Great true sound representation and balance of bass imaging. Comfortable to wear and a great price. Also great for recording as they a closed-back. Foldup feature great for travel!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Extremely good sounding, and well balanced. Crisp, clean, natural sounding highs, smooth mids, and present, tight, clean low end. If the sound source you are plugged into can produce the low end, these headphones can re-produce them. The REALLY low end you can almost feel!
Cons: Not comfortable for long periods. I wish the foam that surrounds your ears were thicker so the inside of the phones would be held away from your ears. The cartilage of my outer ears get sore after about an hour of wearing these.
This unit is durable. I've had them for about 3 years now, and my kids use them also. The vinyl/leather surrounding the foam has started to wear out, but after 3 years of pretty heavy use, I'd say that's good. Plus, you can get replacement foams from Sennheiser.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Price,sound,durability
Cons: A little heavy
These headphones are absolutely the best for studio recording. The frequency response is practically flat! I have used them all and unless you just have a ton of money to throw away these combine the features and durability of much more expensive headphones and are a smart purchase.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: I use these for critical listening and they work great! The sound is crisp and I can hear details in the music I've missed for years. For the price, they can't be beat! I got them on Cyber Monday for [$] and I can honestly say there isn't a better set of headphones for that price out there! After 24 hours or so of burning them in, they opened up even more. They are a little tight on the head at first, but after the first 5 hours or so I didn't even notice them on my head. Sennheiser gives you a 2 Year Warranty for broken parts, and even after the warranty expires, its really easy to find/replace parts (like the ear cushions). I would recommend these to anybody on a budget that wants really nice and detailed sounding cans. They might not compete with the $400-$500 sets, but I could NEVER sh ... ell out that much money in the first place for headphones. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Remmy Martin for the price of Budweiser
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable earcups, coil connection cable with more professional look, three day shiping to my door.
Yet it's not a thousand dollar headphone but overall I am very pleased with the HD280 Pro performance. Sound quality is top knot in term of instruments separation, tight bass but overly artificial reproduced. Treble is smooth and there is no metalic sizzling overly high-extended.
Thank you Newegg for the good price that I can afford the HD280 pro without paying full MSRP.
Cons: Nones
Next order with Newegg will be the HD550 when in stock.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: I think the HD 280 are good headpjones. They have limits as well, but here we are talking about headphones that cost less than 100 euros/dollars. So, you expect limits. The good: nice and flat frequency response (although not below 80/100-Hz). Incredible ambient noise reduction (Sennheiser claims -32-dB, I don't know whether this is true but they certainly reduce the noise a lot). Very nice sound in general. The bad: a bit unconfortable if you wear them for long times (remember they are closed-back). Perhaps, someone would complain about the absence of bass below 80-Hz (but this is not my case). In conclusion, good (if not even perfect) if you need to work with sounds in a noisy environment. Otherwise, look for an open headphone that may give you extra-bass response and that could be more ... confortable to wear. The 5 stars are because they are exactly what I was looking for (I work in a noisy environment). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: I have several of this headphone for use in video editing and on-location. I have been very satisfied. In fact, I'm about to buy another one. I like the high isolation performance, which enables me to hear the actual audio signal, even in high noise environments. I also think that the accuracy of the audio produced is very satisfactory. My one concern, born out by about five years usage, is that they are not as robustly built as they could be. I think every set I have has had some piece of plastic break off. So far, none of the breakage has caused a failure. I've learned to wrap the head bands on each side of the padding with black gaffers tape. This aside, I think these headphones perform very well, and are a good value. I recommend them.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfy, good noise canceling properties. Awesome sound, good clarity with good range differences and the ability to separate sounds. even got these for a smokin deal of 99.99!!!
Cons: coiled cord a bit bulky but i dont travel with these much, have a cheaper pair for school
get these puppies, specially if their on sale.!!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: These are the best headphones that I have purchased, though they are may first high quality set. I wouldn't exchange them for anything. The sound is crisp and clear. They are fairly light weight (I have forgotten I had them on).
Cons: These are not for the bass enthusiast. There is not a lot of bass compared to other cheap headphone set I have owned. These were made for the professional audio engineer, not the average head-banger. Some tweaking with the equalizer in you audio software can fix this.
The first language in the instruction manual is actually German. This surprised me, though it shouldn't as they were made by a German company.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Hands Down best quality headphones ever owned
Item.Review:
Pros: These Sennheiser headphones are absolutely amazing. The sound quality is perfect. I can now hear every single detailed sound in every song no matter what genre. They provide good bass, but it's not over the top, and you still get this great sound clarity. They are also really comfortable to wear around for long periods of time, and the coiled cord is great, so you can walk around with these monsters still plugged in. I owned a pair of Bose Tri-Ports, then some Skullcandy's before these, and they don't even compare. Definitely worth the price, a great buy. Great quality and sound.
Cons: These things are monsters, they are really big, and they are a tad heavy if you are used to wearing ear-buds all the time. These are still comfortable though, they have great padding, so really ... not a con to be found on these.
Newegg is amazing as usual. Only place I shop for electronics now pretty much. UPS shipping is wonderful as well, always get everything on time. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Super clear and crisp sound, while at the same time drowning out nearly everything else. I really couldn't ask for more. It really helps when your roommate likes to let the TV go for hours and hours at a high volume, and he's always making tons of noise.
Cons: They're a bit tight on your head, which in retrospect isn't that big of a con. That, and after long periods of time, you can start to sweat a little bit under the plastic/rubber earpiece covers.
I would buy them again in a heartbeat. Truly amazing sound quality for the price. Radiohead never sounded so good :)

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Fits snug and comfy on my head. I can wear these for several hours before taking them off for a bit of a breather. Has great audio clarity for the price. Great build quality- not cheap or fragile feeling.
Cons: None!
The wire's length is up for debate. While these will be longer for a desktop set up, those who have a studio will definitely want to buy these if you need to walk around your work area.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: I use these Sennheiser HD 280 Pros for videography and sound editing. For the price these are one of the best. Durable and sound great. The only headphone that comes close in this price range are the Sony MDR7506s, which aren't as well constructed (though I admit are a tad more comfy)

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Very comfortable headphones that sound amazing. My previous pair of headphones, a gaming headset, was very uncomfortable to have on for more than an hour, but these headphones at times feel almost non-existant. The sound quality is great. Nice, clean and crisp, and enough bass when they need to have it. The long, coiled cord is a must have on any headphones. I wont be buying another pair that doesnt have it. The capability to have both a 3.5mm and a 6.3mm jack is nice, not to mention they're gold plated for best conductivity. Another nice feature for travel is the ability to fold up into a more compact size.
Cons: None really. Not the top of the line sound, but for the price they're at, can't really complain.
Paired with my Creative X-Fi Soundcard, these headphones are ... amazing for music, movies, games, anything. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: The only thing i find better than the fantastic quality, is the unbelievable durability. I've owned mine for over 2 years and the only sign of stress is a bit of wear on the padding on the headband, which is not only common in all headphones but extremely cheap to replace. they are just well built and sturdy headphones that retain their great quality for years if taken care of.
Cons: The only con i can think of is they can be kind of stiff for the first month or two, but after a few months they wear a bit to better fit your head. within a year after owning them I could game for hours with no discomfort. 2 years into ownership and I can be on the computer literally ALL day (10+ hours is not uncommon for what i do) with no discomfort whatsoever. And i do have glasses.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: I've owned some good cans over the years. My dad had a old, heavy pair of Pioneer headphones from the 70's with leather pads. I thought those sounded good. They pale in comparison to these.
There are pieces I've been listening to on cheap around-the-ear headphones for years that I've heard all new nuances in. The passive environmental sound dampening is remarkable.
Cons: There is a bit of heft to them. If you're used to over- or in-ear headphones, or lightweight around-ear, it will take a while for you to get accustomed to these.
If you're using them with a portable media player, you may not get as much performance - they need some watts to drive them. They are also reference phones, which means they have flat (or nearly flat) response. A good EQ will improve you ... r experience.
I have mine hooked up to a PC with a Creative Labs Audigy2 card, running Spacial Audio SAM Broadcaster, using its broadcast-quality sound processor. This really highlights the difference in headphones. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: During the day, I work in a cubical surrounded by other cubicals. With these headphones on, the only way I know my phone is ringing is because it has a red flashing light. Needless to say, these are GREAT at blocking out ambient noise. The sound reproduction is accurate and the sound stage is good - especially considering the price. The bass does not hit as hard as some of the semi-closed headphones, but it is responsive. These headphones are durable and comfortable. I can wear them for hours when I'm editing video. All in all, if you are on a budget but want great sounding headphones, I would recommend these.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound Quality is amazing, if you editing music or videos, or simply just want a nice pair of headphones you will not be disappointed. I have had many moments where I have heard things that I couldn't hear with cheaper models. These are truly GREAT
Cons: none
Buy these. Great deal

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: The Sennhiser HD 280 Pro headphone are a great flat frequency response and sensitive response headphone great for recording and mixing. They are closed back and have a good sound isolation. But being closed back they are uncomfortable after a while (sweaty ears).

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: Great headphones! Great sound and very comfortable. However, they don't block out very much outside sound like they claim to do. For the money, you can't get a better pair of headphones. Great sound quality, completely covers ears, able to produce very loud and well rounded sound. These are very nice headphones. They seem to be made of durable plastic and you can replace various pieces on it as they wear out. I personally thought the headphones were expensive, but I have never purcahsed a nice pair before. The more research I did, I discovered that these particular headphones were basically the best value for the money.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: What can I say? The headphones sound great. There's no shortage of volume, made even better with the fact that they're basically noise-canceling. The bass is especially able to be heard.
Cons: They're a bit... big. But that's made up in its comfortability.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: These headphones are sturdily built and sound great.
Cons: They were very uncomfortable. As other reviewers said they are very tight on your head and I have an average size head, not a gargantuan cranium. They also sit uncomfortably on the top of your head, possibly because of the weight, and limited padding. The ear pieces were a tiny bit smaller than the other Sennheiser's I've tried, making my ears feel 'cramped'. I couldn't wear them more than 30 minutes without a pretty good headache.
My Old HD 265s were infinitely more comfortable - they have larger ear pieces, weigh less and don't 'clamp' on your head nearly as tight. I have been able to ear those for hours and hours without any discomfort since I took them out of the box.
If you have a small head the ... se may be comfortable, otherwise I'd look for another set of headphones. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: They are Durable. The sound quality is decent, comparable to other headphones in a lower price bracket.
Cons: EXTREMELY TIGHT. They get uncomfortable after 1hour+. Even with the adjustments, it's just painful for your head. Heavy bulky cord, if you need any extension it will drag the headphones. Sound quality is not worth the price. I've owned multiple "Gaming" headsets (fatal1ty, turtlebeach) with the exact same sound quality and they were much more comfortable to boot.
I got fooled by all the user ratings. Never gonna trust these anymore. Discount deals always suck. Either settle for cheap or go all out for the good stuff.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Great unit for the price. Sound quality is excellent, tight and crisp. Outstanding low frequency reproduction. Very clean, low noise, not muddy at all. Light and comfortable with adequate ambient noise attenuation.
Cons: You're not actually at the concert, it just sounds like you are.
Would recommend. Impressed with NewEgg.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: These are simply the best phones I've ever owned. These things handle anything I throw at them and want to eat up more.
I listen to all types of music - Techo, Trance, Hip Hop, Metal, Rock, Punk -as well as produce my own Trance- and I'm telling you that these puppies handle them all and is still hungry for more. Very solid Deep Lows, and amazing highs - with everything in between. Anything 192kps & higher MP3's will sound amazing....lower and you begin to really hear artifacts in poorly encoded mp3.
FLAC audio sounds freaking amazing! Nuff' said.
They do require a small break-in to sound great. Mine took a couple hours. Now that they've cleared their throat, they simply sound amazing. Buy these.
Cons: None.
Extreemly pleased with the whole pur ... chase. These might be the best phones on the market for their very reasonable price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: Well, like me, you might be looking for accurate headphones that you can use during recording, mixing and even practicing. Well, then don't buy these Sennheisers. Don't get me wrong..they are OKAY headphones. But just okay. They are comfortable and seem fairly well made, but they are TOTALLY INACCURATE when it comes to sound reproduction. There's hardly any bass, there's too much midrange, and the high end is a bit screechy. Don't believe me? Then go down to your local guitar shop, try these through the headphone jack on any Yamaha digital piano (I love my S90ES). Then try a set of Beyerdynamic 770 pro 80's. Though the Beyers are twice the price, they are 4 times as accurate as these guys. And accuracy is EVERYTHING when you are recording/mixing.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Great pair for a great price
Item.Review: I use these headphones for PC use like listening to my music collection which contains all sorts of genres from classical, to rap and playing games. The response is very linear, which I like. Great for classical music where you want the most faithful reproduction. Low and high's are great, but ultimately, these are closed headphones which all suffer from mids being slightly reverberated. Comfort is also very good. After I broke the cushion in, I'd wear these anywhere from 1 hour all the way to monster 6-hour sessions and I'd never feel them on my head - even while wearing glasses. Between performance, comfort, and ease of use, these headphones are hard to beat at its price.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Best headphones for $65. Crystal clear sound. Flat equalizer. Listen to a CD, and you'll really be amazed. Folds up into a compact design for those long flights.
Cons: They are a bit big and bulky, but all great headphones are.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Well, those are really nice headphones for that price. Bass is deep and thrilling though "warm".The biggest advantage is the amazing and realistic surround effects. They will make you look around. And you can fold them in pretty tiny package, though cable is a little bit heavy.
Cons: The high range does not sound crystal clear by default. If you like to enjoy "right" sound of music you will have to play with equalizer a little bit. But even than there is no of that vibrating crystal clear sound in high range, that i have on my grados.
The best option in given price range. The perfect choice for music, movie and game lovers with limited finance.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Very impressed, even after reading a large number of raving reviews about these headphones I was still a bit surprised. I found myself digging out my cd collection because the audio shortcomings in mp3's are much more noticeable all the sudden. The Bass is clear and precise and I've checked with just about every genre of music I listen to ranging from classical to death metal and everything is beautiful, I even found myself leaning off the srs effects in media player on my computer in favor of the clear reproduction these headphones provide. This is a first I'm upgrading into these after owning a pair of sony pro series for some time deciding it was time to replace them as they were aging. I can not stress enough how Glad I am I spent a few extra dollars to get these over my other ch ... oices.
Cons: If any I would say the reproduction may be a little too clear for some music formats lower bitrate mp3's sound pretty bad on these as all the shortcomings of the format become abundantly clear almost immediately. As some have said you will look a bit geeky wearing them on the go, but the sound quality far outweighs any possible embarrassment. 64 ohm impedance will be a little rough on battery powered devices.
I can not stress enough how satisfied I am with this purchase. If your holding off on these because of the price, you will not be disappointed when they arrive. Replaceable pads and a 2 year warranty both support headphones that are built to both satisfy a consumer and last. Backed by a good company with a solid reputation I would recommend these to my own mother. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable Great sound Build quality
Cons: A bit bulky maybe? Doesn't bother my any.
These things are phenomenal. They are a bit tight, so I left one of my son's 6 inch bouncy balls between the speakers for a couple nights and fixed that problem. Instructions are included showing how to replace all the padding and the cable for future wear. Lastly, the sound is incredible. Nothing like any headphones I've ever had.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent noise isolation, incredible sound reproduction, great value. You will notice details in your music that you have never heard before.
Cons: I wasted too much money on pair after pair of cheap headphones. I finally realized that if you buy a quality pair of headphones they will sound incredible and not break every few months.
A little advice: 1. Burn these in for a couple days, the improvement in sound quality is dramatic
2. If you feel the bass is lacking (a common complaint) adjust your EQ settings. These are capable of some downright incredible bass if that is what you are looking for

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Great headphones for the money, love them
Item.Review: These headphones were everything I hoped they would be when I read the reviews. Very easy to use, comfortable when on for extended periods of time (wore it for about 2 hours and only felt slight uncomfortable feeling), and the sound covers highs and lows quite nicely. I would definitely recommend these to anyone who is interested in a high quality set of headphones but for an average to low price.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: Great sound quality, good fit, flexible in the field. I am very happy with this product both in the field and at my office. Cancels outside noises very well and i am very pleased with the quality.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Sennheiser HD 280 PRO 3.5mm/ 6.3mm Connector Circumaural Professional DJ & Studio Headphone
Item.Review:
Pros: Awesome response. Tight bass. Overall great sound. I'm very happy with these coupled with a high quality sound card. I've used these in live environments for PFL on a mixer. I hear stuff through these headphones that just disappear when listening on other cheaper sets.
Cons: You'll look like a dork wearing them. The headband has started to come off and I can't find a replacement (after about 4 years). I'm pretty sure these have been discontinued.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sound, excludes noise, folds small. I've owned these for 28 months and taken them on numerous long flights; as long as 10+ hours. They are great to exclude the engine noise and especially important if you are surrounded by crying babies.
Cons: The main complaint is that the foam cushions have fallen apart. Inside seam separated. I don't abuse them, this is a design flaw. It did take this long (just out of warranty) for them to get bad enough to replace. I easily ordered a replacement set from the Sennheiser website store for $25 including shipping. I like the headphones but at $100 the cushions should last more than two years of occasional use. Also - The cord is nice and long but sometimes a little cumbersome to stow in my camera bag.
I took one side off to consi ... der stitching then back together, didn't seem like it would be easy. It was difficult to put the cushion back on. I did get it though. Also - on trips I bought a square plastic box to store/protect them on trips while not flying. Rick Steves soft bag offers no protection. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: For the same money, you can get a pair of Sony MD-7506?s which are much more accurate headphones. The Sennheisers are built like a tank, if a bit heavy. They definitely seal outside sounds out. The problem I have with them is the lack of clarity and accuracy in the important midrange area. They have lots of sizzle (too much?) and their bottom end is very deep. (Heavy bass can make them distort, however...) I own both these and the Sony's and reach for the Sony's when I need to listen for accuracy. The Sennheisers are great for general purpose listening.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Overall, i will give them a perfect in terms of how they sound, how the feel and for my application usage, i won't be negative about the burn in process as it did not effect me very much, though admitingly it was scary to get a $100 pair of headphones that sounded like something made in a basement, Read Quality about burning in the head phones ot increase thier performance. I love how the cans swivle, it helps with pressure against your head, everybody has a different shape which makes us unique and these compensate for that uniquness. The high's and Mid's are amazing, but read the "Quality" part of my review on more about this. It comes with a 1/4' screw on adapter which is hand, plug it into your MP3 player or PC and use the adapter for your intruments. I urge anyone purchasing he ... adphones, whether these or another, to read this
The Quality, when i first pulled these out of the box i felt like i wasted $100, they didn't sound much better than a $15 pair of wal mart ear buds, even the bass was bad, it was distorting the entire reverb on any note, playing classical music, no problem, playing a R&B song, sounded like someone blowing in your ear at best, i had a 192khz/24bit raw sample available of many different sounds and it was bad, i mean real bad.
Here is the thing, little did i know you have to "burn-in" headphones, yeah, news to me, well i followed a guide which you can google "Burn in headphones guide" or something of that nature and come up with some information. I do NOT suggest using white noise, pink noise or any of that garbage, set a playlist of several different types of music, some with guitar, some with bass, some with female singers, male singers, get a good 100 hours of music and put it on repeat for about 5 or 6 hours, put the volume at normal listening volume (it doesn't need to be any louder than that!) and just leave it, come back and let your headphones "rest" for about 30 minutes, if you want, you can continue stressing, this time for 10 hours, do an increase in time after each pause but start alittle lower (3-5 hours) work up to 10 until you have stressed it for a total of about 80-100 hours including normal usage.
I did this for 8 hours today after my initial dissapointment and i honestly had zero hope it would make any difference, but holy cow it did!, the bass on these picked up to a nice smooth woof like it's supposed to be, it isn't a hard hit but it's enough to know its there and feel it in your head without distorting the rest of the sounds like it was doing. I was more interested in the highs and Mids because i am a pianist, but i'm considering these for netflix and other multimedia purposes now. I don't think they are quite where they should be and from my limited knowledge they will get a massive leap in quality around 50 hours, at this 50 hour point if they continue to gain in performance like thye did before i'm going to think they are more valuable than i paid for them.
I can't stress enough how much of a difference it made, there is no need to turn them up very loud, i had them at about speech volume in my ears which isn't very loud, just normal usage volume. Turning them up to much isn't going to help or make the burn in go any faster, it juust risks ruining your headphones. At first i thought i got ripped off, see Quality above. you really need to burn these headphones in to hear what they can really do. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: These headphone have amazing isolation, I can't hear my fans, the heater or the keyboard I typing now. I can listen to song at ridiculous low volume and have them still sound amazing. It has great detail, especially listening to classical music, yet have enough base for hip-hop
Cons: The coiled single cord is really bothering me. I have them connect to my computer setting on the floor. Because the wires are coiled, most them on in air, so I have carry the entire length of wire with my head. Since the wire is only on one side, so it isn't balanced. After a few hour, i can feel a strain in my neck. Also the clamping force is a bit to get used to, but that's the price you pay for good isolation.
great deal for $100, especially with the free PXC-150 combo deal. But also con ... sider headphones with an open design if you don't need the isolation, those produce a truer sound expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: I generally don't write reviews, but this product is truly exceptional and a very good price. I have been searching for a superior set of earphones for years to use for live recording and general listening - a lot of experimenting and wasted money. These phones really do the job. They have a transparency and definition that makes listening a real joy and provide the level of detail required for quality recording. They came bundled with a pair of PXC-150 noise-cancelling phones for free. These are fun to play with.
Cons: There is a claim of 32db of isolation, and this is rather wishful thinking. I wear sound isolators on the job, and know what 28db (very high level) of isolation sounds like. These phones do, however, have better isolation than any other phones I have tried ... with the exception of experimental phones I have constructed for my own use and in-the-ear units - they are quite adequate for most recording, and the exceptional sound quality makes up for a lot. The other overly-optimistic claim is that they collapse down to a compact size. Frankly, they are just big, and they do get a bit smaller. Not really for the subway. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: I am heavily into listeing classical music (European and Indian). The sound is extreley clear and very very crispy. The bass sound is of pretty high quality, but not overwhelming. And it is not a gaming headphone, its for serious music. I am happy that I got it.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: If you are looking for headphones for studio use, these may be for you. If not, I would pass. The sound is adequate, but not great. I listen mainly to classical music and the string sound produced by these is kind of thin (like the old transistor radio sound) and lacks body. Also, they sound a little weak in bass and detail in the low frequencies is not very impressive. Even more of a problem is the sheer bulk of these big goofy looking headphones. If you are thinking of using these at work, know that they will look awfully big on your head. The black coiled chord is the old Bell Telephone sort, so heavy that it can pull an ipod off a table, or cause the headphones to tilt to one side if you wear them while walking around. The sound is not good enough to justify the antiquated physical des ... ign, which needs to be updated. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: They are very comfortable, fully surround your ears, yet still manage to seem light and remarkably unannoying. Despite not being too heavy on the head, they very effectively mute-out almost all ambient sounds, so all you'll hear is the great sound coming from the speakers. I specifically bought them wanting this feature. That ear-isolation helps to create a great sound and exceptional bass.
Cons: I own two sets of these. I love them both. I've owned them for more than 5 years and they still sound awesome. Before I bought them, I read a person's review who claimed part of the plastic would eventually fall apart. Another reviewer accused him of just mistreating them. I can tell you. There is a part of the band that goes over your head: it will eventually begin to flake into shar ... ds and disintegrate (both sides, on both my sets). However, the speakers, all the wires, and even all the hinge points (thank goodness) are not susceptible to this problem. Only the plastic encasing arch on either side of the main head pad, and extending almost to the first pivots, is affected. (there is a strong/light metal skeleton inside the main arch) Long story short: it takes a long time to develop and it will never will truly "ruin" them.
On a side-note, the complex folding variations of these headphones turns out to be very handy, in my opinion. It's almost impossible to stress these, because the seem to want to fold or pivot quite naturally in every direction. The most important pieces of plastic (structural pieces, pivots and joints) do not break, and seem to want to last forever. I use these constantly, very happy. Absolute 5 out of 5 if not for the odd but persistent plastic headband breakdown. So I gotta give 4. Love 'em like 5. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: These headphones have very crisp and clear sound, and plenty of bass but not an excessive amount. The first time I listened to my music collections with these I was blown away. I could hear all sorts of little nuances that I had never noticed before. The noise cancelling is very nice also, it allows you to listen to the music at a quieter volume (which is less fatiguing) but still hear all the details. They seem quite durable as well. I've had 2 pairs of them, the first pair only needed to be replaced due to me abusing them by stepping on them. I've had the 2nd pair about 3 years and they still sound/look pretty much brand new.
Cons: If you have any lower quality mp3s it will be very noticeable. Anything below 256kbps mp3 will have bad artifacts, and I need 320kbps mp3 ... or wav/flac now. This isn't really a con so much, just something to be aware of :)
They do take some time to "break in" but this is true of all hi-quality speakers/headphones. They sound good from the start, but they sound even better after several hours of using them. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Best headphones I've purchased to date.
Item.Review:
I purchased these recently after doing a lot of debating, review reading, and comparing. For the price and the quailty you really can't beat these. The reviews were very accurate, there's a good presence of bass and low-end you can hear. They're very comfortable and you really can't beat the price. Although they were $5 cheaper at Guitar Center, that's alright cause these came straight to my door.
The only thing I'd suggest is picking up an extension cable from wal-mart because the cable on these is coiled and really won't extend too far beyond a laptop being right in front of you. I mean just look at the price. I urge you to attempt to find a better quality at this price. You won't be able to.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Long time owner, still in love!
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable for long time wearing, crystal clear sound on all ranges! I being using these as my study pair (Eng. student) for almost 2 years and they still have not come apart or loosen any quality, in fact they get better over time. Can be very loud if and still accurate if pushed, in fact some times I just leave them on my desk as small speakers. Great sound isolation too.
Cons: Somewhat big, a bit heavy and tight, but I still use for hours on end.
I don't think many in understand that these headphones need some breaking in, that is you need to play music on them for a while before they loosen up. The Base was flat the first week I had it, but it certainly loosen up after playing on them a while. They get better as time goes on, don't judge these until you use them fo ... r a good while. I also use these for gaming which makes them the only headphones I have being able to use for both very high quality sound and laud game sounds. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable earcups. Clear treble and accurate bass. Very sturdy, heavy plastic construction. Collapsable and foldable. Not the best sounding headphones in the world, but definitely worth the price you pay.
Cons: Does not come with a carrying pouch...
Bass is accurate but not powerful. This means songs with very deep bass like Nine Inch Nails sound amazing, but conventional music may sound hollow depending on what you are used to.
The headband is very uncomfortably tight on the head when it is brand new, but they stretch out after a week or two and become more comfortable.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Great build quality; cushy pads; crisp audio output; decent bass; significant (but not 100%) ambient noise reduction.
Cons: N/A
Having these 'phones has only made me want to invest in a discreet sound card and load my system up with lossless tracks. With these you'll begin to notice nuances in songs you've listened to countless times...they bring definition to an otherwise flat listening experience.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Good Sound, Not So Good Build...
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound is accurate
Cons: Build of Headband
I purchased these after much research and can say that Sennheiser hasn't let me down. I put them on and the sound was crisp and impressed me from the beginning. However...my one complaint is the way they fit. They're comfortable and all, but when I glanced into the mirror I realized how ridiculous I looked b/c of how far they bowed out from my head. I plan on wearing these in public on occasion and honestly wouldn't feel comfortable doing so with this particular pair. This shouldn't discourage ppl from purchasing them unless they're avid public users, I just personally feel a little silly. I think I will exchange for something a little more snug.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Value
Cons: Nothing.
General Observations: - I've read reviews where people say the cord is too short. I disagree. - The earmuffs do a good job of isolating sound without being noise-cancelling. - People have complained that the bass is substandard. Again, I disagree. Bass capabilities are not bad. - As for comfort, everybody's head is different. Mine is kind of large but I can wear these for a few hours without wanting to take them off.
I mostly got them for listening to mp3's and occasionally playing video games, for which, they work great. For my applications, I wasn't ready to break that $300 mark. If you're looking for a decent set of headphones that won't break the bank, then I think you'll be satisfied.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Cheap when I got them on sale here. Couldn't resist buying it at that price. Very clean sound.
Cons: TOO TIGHT! It's like having my head in a vice. I wear headphones almost 24/7, but even after just about 30 minutes of wearing these, I ended up getting a migraine. It's a bummer really. I was so looking forward to them, and now I can't even stand to wear them. Iunderstand they need to be pressed up on the ears to work as intended, but it certainly doesn't need to be this tight. Even after I modded them to be looser, I still couldn't stand it. I went back to my Sony MDR XB500's, which don't sound as good (obviously) but the comfort of them is off the charts. The Sony 500's are like little Pillows on my head. It's Sublime comfort.
If you don't mind tight headphones then ma ... ybe these are for you, but people like me who wear headphones 24/7; I can't see these being an option. They're simply too tight. I wish I didn't buy them. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: A great selection for the price!
Item.Review:
Pros: The sound is phenomenal, great performance and extremely high tops, though the soundstage doesn't feel as open as it should on the ends of the frequency range. Bass can go down very deep, but these headphones neutralize any boosting and create sound that is nearly exactly what the masterers intended.
Cons: Though sturdy, it is a little clunky to get around. It feels big around your head, and some people say that it doesn't stretch far enough (if you have a big head, these might not be for you). Not very loud on iPhones/mp3 players due to the high (64 Ohm) resistance.
If you listen to music and you'd like a lot of bass, the Sony MDR-7506 is a good replacement.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: Overall, I would definately recommend these phones for an in-home studio use. I haven't had a lot of headphones to compare them to, but they will definitely serve the purpose I need. I love these headphones for the purpose I bought them. I am using them in an in-home studio environment and they are awesome. The block most noise and the clarity is great. I find nothing wrong with the quality of these phones except the scrunchy cord. I personally don't like the elasticity of the cord because I feel like it pulls at me constantly if I move away from a device. These phones are a great value. These aren't some $9.99 CD headphones. These are a real pro's choice.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable; Good Value; Durable; Great Sound
Cons: Unattractive Design; Too Much Ambient Noise
Good sound quality. Don't claim to be noise canceling, but do a reasonable job. Can't compete with Bose in that category, but at 1/3 the price, I wouldn't expect them to.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: I am very happy with the subject headphones on all accounts. Try them and I feel you will agree!! The headphones encompass your entire ear, provide excellent sound quality, are attractive, and appear to be well made. As an added benefit the essential parts are replaceable if damaged, which is a unique quality. Excellent quality, very comfortable, sound is beatiful, it address my needs at a reasonable price. The build quality, sound quality, and comfort for the price is what determines value for me and these headphone are a 10 on all counts!!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Sturdy. I like the thick cord.
Cons: I bought these to replace my HD265's because the cord on them is wimpy and I've had to replace the cord twice. The highs and mids are ok on the HD280's but the bass is weak when I compare to my HD265. The HD 265's have a warm, full, strong bass and the HD280 seem to be trying so hard to be almost that. These truly sound like any other $39 dollar headset.
They just do not make stuff like they used to! I'll give the HD280 headset to someone as a X-mas gift and buy yet another cord my HD265's.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: I've owned these phones for 2 years and have yet to encounter 1 issue with them. They sound incredible and the overall durability is excellent. I've owned AKG, Sony, and many others and they all fall far short on sound quality and overall construction. My phones still look new and perform great with no pad wear. The price is insanely low for what you get and sound quality exceeds many phones costing 4x as much. You cannot go wrong with these.
Cons: None. Some complain about the coiled cable.. You either love or hate it but it's super long and perfect for a studio etc.
If you're skeptical, listen yourself at any music store that sells these. You'll find out for yourself that these phones sound the best for the price point. Compare with a $400.00 pair and you'll he ... ar how great these sound. Very detailed sound with awesome bass response. A very balanced detailed sound in all aspects. BTW, you can get a microphone attachment for these. A very cool feature. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent Bass and Treble ....Pretty much hearing all different kind of instrument that wasn't present on my other headphones. Comfortable around the ears. Can't believed how long this model been around.
Cons: Hurt a little on top of the head, guess from being bald headed.
First owned sennheiser

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable; Good Value; Stylish; Compact
Cons: Uncomfortable
Sound is good, design is good. I bought this headphone for comfort but it gives everything except comfort. It is too tight on my ears. I hope it will loose in some time. Till that time, my toaster is wearing it.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: These headphones are great! The treble is nice and balanced with the bass. And the bass is only there if it needs to be. Very clear sound and comfortable. Plus, it looks like individual components on the headphones can be replaced if needed.
Cons: None right now.
Well worth the money spent.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Reproduction is very good, but db attenuation is great. I find myself wearing them not plugged in on plane flights to quell the jet noise, and I'm much more relaxed at flight's end. Even without noise cancellation it's nearly as good as those that have it. If you do want to listen on the plane, the volume doesn't have to override so much background noise.
Cons: Infrequent price reductions!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Good overall linear response with good base, treble, and mid-range. Decent isolation of outside noise. Durable design for home/work use.
Cons: Too bulky for portable use. HF5 fits the "student" bill for portability. Bass dips a tiny bit at very low frequency. Don't block low frequency outside noise at all.
Really good for a student/gamer set of headphones as they will cut out the fan noise from case fans while under use. You hate the tinnyness or boominess of cheaper headphones? You can't go wrong with these!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: The quality of these headphones are absolutely great. The sound quality is also stunning. I must say that these were worth the money. They are comfortable too. I play many FPS games, and these are a beautiful addition to my gameplay experience.
Cons: To be honest it seems as if dampens the bass just a bit. That and it drains battery life of my Zune faster. Even though they are comfortable, they can slide off if you put your head back, not too much a problem though. They also seem pretty bulky (even despite the fact that they are headphones)
Even though there are some cons, I believe that the pros are better, thus 5 eggs. Also, they may not look very cool when you're wearing them, but when they are put around your neck you feel like a total bad*ss.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Best headphones I have ever purchased. These things will change the way you listen to music. Every part is pretty simple to replace and you also get a 2 year warranty. The accuracy of the sound is astonishing.
Cons: NOP!
SENNHEISER makes the best headphones money can buy.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 280 Pro - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Black
Item.Review: I use these for home recording. I don't have a headphone amp, so I run them through an old Technics receiver. I use the Loudness control on the receiver to compensate for the flat response. They sound great and are very well made. They do a great job of isolation. I find they are a little tight on my head.
